text: And this edge has become so noisy. But back in 2012, 2013, it used to be, if you were one of the people that went through their perspectives on VXX or UVXY, so what I did was I just, it's like a table in Excel and in Python where you just see the holdings at certain times of the month. And so it used to be, it's not, it's way noisier now and more difficult to harvest now. But you could just time it based on the weighted basket of VIX futures in the ETF. So in other words, you could sit out for a majority of the month in cash. And then at the sweet spot, when the portfolio is closer to 50-50, then that roll yield is really grinding away at the product, then just short them. And so what eventually happened is people got hip to that. And so then it became, okay, not just the sweet spot of the month, but we need to quantify a way to track the basis. So when the basis gets stretched, but not too stretched, plus... We have this 50-50 or even 55-45 basket of VIX futures. So you have those two things going, then you short it. Then people got aware of that. Then it became to the point where it's like, okay, now we're just going to play for this product to decay. And so then can we at least buy the downside, the puts, for a reasonable price that if this thing continues to drift downward, I can still get some sort of return on my money. And now if the market's gotten so smart that... You can't even... You can't even do that. People think they're clever buying these puts in the VIX complex and the ETPs. The market's ahead of that. And that trade has not done well. You'd be better off just shorting the underlying or shorting the VIX future. But that's an example of how that trade morphed from when it was super easy to got a little bit harder. You had to track that basis when it was stretched, but not too stretched to get that last... Because what you're trying to do is you're trying to get that last piece of decay, right? Then people got onto that. And then all of a sudden, now there's not nearly as much edge in those products. As there used to be.
